messages.message:
Hey team! :wave: I’m planning to remove *`babel-plugin-lodash`* since it’s unmaintained and keeps throwing the `isModuleDeclaration deprecation` warning (PR (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/73774)).
This plugin used to tree-shake lodash imports, but we can achieve the same (and better) by adjusting how we import lodash:

:white_check_mark: *Preferred*
```import { get } from 'lodash-es';     // best: groups multiple imports on one line```
:white_check_mark: *Also acceptable*
```import get from 'lodash/get';
import get from 'lodash-es/get';```
:x: *Avoid*
```import { get } from 'lodash';        // pulls in the entire lodash bundle```
For functional programming:
:white_check_mark: Do this
```import get from 'lodash/fp/get';```
:x: *Avoid*
```import { get } from 'lodash/fp';     // imports entire fp bundle```
We still end up including lodash because of 3rd-party deps, but using `lodash-es` helps us prep for the future: once those libraries update or we drop them, we’ll be able to reduce our bundle size.
